body_html:
Recent I'm doing a project using the elegant tool,pytorch. I use the dropout2d and batchnorm2d in my network.The trained model performance well in the test phase if I didn't using the model.eval(). However,when I use the model.eval(), the result is very pool. I really feel confused.I sincerely hope the developer can help me solving this confusion. Thank you very much!

Have you solved this problem by decreasing the momentum in BatchNorm layer?

body:
> Recent I'm doing a project using the elegant tool,pytorch. I use the dropout2d and batchnorm2d in my network.The trained model performance well in the test phase if I didn't using the model.eval(). However,when I use the model.eval(), the result is very pool. I really feel confused.I sincerely hope the developer can help me solving this confusion. Thank you very much!

Have you solved this problem by decreasing the momentum in BatchNorm layer?
